strategy: Implement a time-of-day based mixed strategy where the row player adjusts their probability of choosing the "same activity" option based on the local time of day. During peak daylight hours (10 AM to 4 PM), the row player sets a higher probability of 0.7 to align with increased likelihood of outdoor activities. During evening and nighttime hours (6 PM to 10 PM), the probability drops to 0.3, reflecting a higher chance of indoor activities. This leverages temporal patterns as exogenous signals of activity preferences.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > strategy.py
import random
def row_strategy(history):
    current_time = len(history) % 24
    if 10 <= current_time < 16:  # Peak daylight hours (10 AM - 4 PM)
        return random.choices([0, 1], weights=[0.7, 0.3])[0]
    elif 18 <= current_time < 22:  # Evening hours (6 PM - 10 PM)
        return random.choices([0, 1], weights=[0.3, 0.7])[0]
    else:  # All other times
        return random.choices([0, 1], weights=[0.5, 0.5])[0]
ENDOFFILE
